etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish صچرامق (sıçramak, “to leap, jump; to splash, splatter”), probably a derivation of Proto-Turkic *sač- (“to scatter, spatter, sow”), whence also saç-.
Cognate with Old Turkic [script needed] (saçıra-, saçra-), Azerbaijani sıçramaq, Salar sıçra, Turkmen syçramak, Kazakh шашыра- (şaşyra-), etc.
